location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the volume.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the inside front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 221; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. The file has one foliation anomaly, f 36a.

mods.abstract: This volume contains parts 4 and 5 of the subject 'Arabia' as follows:Part 4, IOR/L/PS/10/938/1, 'Arabia: [Nejd] Question of channel of communication between H. M. Govt & Ibn Saud' (folios 4-208)Part 5, 'Arabia: Political Situation, the Turkish Peace Treaty and the future political status of Yemen and Asir' (folios 209-220).Each part includes a divider, which gives the subject and part numbers, the year the subject file was opened, the subject heading, and list of correspondence references contained in that part by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
